instruction: How did the study use prefrontal functional near-infrared spectroscopy and convolutional neural networks (CNN) to investigate brain functional changes in drug users?
Output:
The study used prefrontal functional near-infrared spectroscopy (fNIRS) to measure hemoglobin concentrations in the brains of drug users. This technique allows researchers to assess changes in brain activity by measuring the levels of oxygenated and deoxygenated hemoglobin.

In addition, the study employed convolutional neural networks (CNN) to classify different functional areas of the prefrontal cortex. CNN is a type of deep learning algorithm that is particularly effective in analyzing visual data. In the study, the CNN was trained to classify eight specific areas of the prefrontal cortex, as well as the entire prefrontal area.

By combining fNIRS measurements with CNN classification, the researchers were able to analyze and compare the brain activity patterns of drug users. They examined the classification accuracy of the different functional areas in drug users on methamphetamine, heroin, and mixed drugs. The study aimed to identify any differences in brain activity between the three types of drug users and determine the specific areas of the prefrontal cortex that were affected by drug addiction.
